messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] Re: Jean Auel
messages.msgSnippet: ... There s a whole series along that line by Michael Gear and Kathleen O Neal Gear. I ve read a bunch of them and enjoyed them. They all start with People of
messages.messageBody:
> I read her books YEARS ago and still like that kind of book. Check out
> the
>White Mare books by Judith Tarr. Prehistory, but more Native American-ish
>than Caveman-ish. But very good.

There's a whole series along that line by Michael Gear and Kathleen O'Neal
Gear. I've read a bunch of them and enjoyed them. They all start with
People of the . . . Earth, Fire, Wolf, etc.
Tia

messages.subject: Re: Jean Auel
messages.msgSnippet: I read her books YEARS ago and still like that kind of book.  Check out the White Mare books by Judith Tarr.  Prehistory, but more Native American-ish than
messages.messageBody:
I read her books YEARS ago and still like that kind of book. Check out the
White Mare books by Judith Tarr. Prehistory, but more Native American-ish
than Caveman-ish. But very good.
Mary J
